org.dinopolis.gpstool.alarm
Class PositionAlarmCondition

java.lang.Object
  org.dinopolis.gpstool.alarm.PositionAlarmCondition
All Implemented Interfaces:
AlarmCondition, EventListener, PropertyChangeListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
LeavePositionAlarmCondition
public class PositionAlarmCondition
extends Object
implements AlarmCondition

A PositionAlarmCondition is informed about any changes of the current position by the use of a property change event or by calling the setPosition method. If the condition is true (a specific position resp. area is entered, it calls the listener and passes the action that was previously set.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Christof Dallermassl

Method Detail

propertyChange

public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent event)
Callback method for property change events (GPSDataProcessor). This class forwards GPSDataProcessor.LOCATION events to the setPosition method.

Specified by:
propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener
Parameters:
event - the property change event.

setPosition

public void setPosition(double latitude,
                        double longitude)
Sets the current position. This method performs the check, if the alarm condition is true and calls the alarm listener in that case. If no listener was set, the isAlarm method returns, if the position triggered an alarm.

Parameters:
latitude - the latitude to calculate the condition for.
longitude - the latitude to calculate the condition for.

isAlarmDistance

public boolean isAlarmDistance(double distance)
Returns true, if the given distance is less than the alarm distance. This method may be overriden by subclasses that triggers on a distance.

Parameters:
distance - the distance to the current gps position.
